result.execSummary:
The defendant Beverly L Terrell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Straight time.
1 day credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with any Target.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

filed from Meta House filed by Defense
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Beverly L Terrell in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 1 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 2:
- 5 months jail straight time STAYED for 1 year probation - 1 day if revoked
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling. No contact with any target.   Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Treatment letter filed.

Defendant Beverly L Terrell in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses non compliance with WCS.  State requests a modification in bail.  Attorney Menden makes a statement to the Court in regards to the inpatient care and requests the Court not modify bail.  Court does not modify the bail.   Bail remains as fixed.    Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.

Menden requests to adjourn hearing. State has no objection to the adjournment. Court adjourns. Court authorizes capias but stays to the next date. Court needs documentation regarding the inpatient treatment from the defendant  Hearing scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Preliminary hearing on August 6, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.
